dublin_core.dcvalue: Mobile SMS-based disease outbreak alert system (mSOS) is a formatted text-message system that allows real-time communication between health facility workers and disease surveillance coordinators at the sub-county, county, and national levels in line with the IDSR guidelines.
Facility-based provider, Public sector health system (national, regional, district), Government agency
Dr. Daniel Langat, Disease Surveillance and Response Unit, Ministry of Health, Kenya, langat4@yahoo.com

Original pilot: 67 health facilities in 12 sub-counties in Busia and Kajiado counties (border counties with Tanzania and Uganda)
Scale-up efforts: Republic of Kenya (national, county, sub-county, and health facility levels in 47 counties â€“ approximately 7,500 health facilities)

Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA), Japan Agency for Medical Research and Development (AMED), World Health Organization (WHO) [SIKIWIS], US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), USAID

Data collection and reporting, Electronic health records, Provider work planning and scheduling, Provider training and education, Registries and vital events tracking, Infectious Diseases, Malaria and other vector-borne diseases
